blocks.description: Some companies won"t ask you algorithm problems. Instead, they might focus more on implementation and operational problems. These are usually more niche and involve practical problems, like looping through data and performing a task of some sort.

blocks.description: System design questions are crucial questions that show you are more than just a coder. You need to be able to think big picture as an engineer.

description: Software engineering interviews, like other technical interviews, require plenty of preparation. There are a number of subjects that need to be covered in order to ensure you are ready for back-to-back questions on algorithms, data structures, design, optimization and honestly just an ever growing basket of subjects. So I created a checklist on my last round of interviews that covers many of the popular topics.
title: The Interview Study Guide For Software Engineers (by Benjamin Rogojan)

description: Cold emailing remains one of the most underrated skills in today"s world. Most people still read their emails. They just very rarely come across good ones and when they do, they almost always reply weather it"s a job application, business related or anything. Here is my curation of good resources available on the web.
title: The best cold email strategy in 2021.

author: 1064e558-2262-499c-9c99-e98281474886

blocks.title: Codecademy
blocks.description: Codecademy is one of the best platforms to learn javascript, they provide the completion certificate. 1,686,370 students join this course and it"s very easy to learn and faculty is very kind and helpful.

blocks.title: Javascript Essentials
blocks.description: Learn all the basics of Javascript including primitive types, arrays, functions, assignment operators, the window object and much more. Also I"ll provide clear explanations of objects, constructors and arrays in a clear way for anyone to understand. We"ll also dive into some more detail about how Javascript works and even advanced topics like prototype inheritance, scope, execution context and much more.

blocks.title: Javascript.info
blocks.description: The Modern JavaScript Tutorial was created in 2007 by Ilya Kantor, and regularly updated since then. New chapters were added, outdated ones - removed, to stay fresh. The PDF version is about 1300 pages, starting from the beginning, and then to advanced topics. It"s a book, not a video, as for many people reading is faster. Also, books are easier to update, keep modern :).

blocks.title: MDN By Mozilla
blocks.description: MDN is more of a reference tool. Not really structured for learning by newbies. But it is an excellent resource for folks that already have a decent background with the technologies they are reading about. Yes MDN is the best online resource for learning HTML and CSS.

blocks.title: Javascript 30
blocks.description: Javascript 30 is great for showing you some basic ways you can use javascript to create or alter websites. Others are right that there are other things to learn, but practising code and seeing some simple working examples is also very useful.

description: Hello friends, Today we have the top 5 resources that you can use to learn javascript. Javascript is the most popular and flexible programming language on the web. Javascript is used for websites, web app, and more various fields.
title: Top 5 Best Resources To Learn Javascript

author: 1064e558-2262-499c-9c99-e98281474886
description: In software engineering interview process system design round has become a standard part of the interview. Real-world system design is challenging and complex. System design interview questions are usually open ended discussions.
title: System Design Actual Interview Questions

author: 1064e558-2262-499c-9c99-e98281474886

blocks.title: Head First Python
blocks.description: I’m a big fan of the Head First series. They"re just awesome books to read through. Head First Python is tremendously helpful for anyone starting out with the language.

blocks.title: Python Crash Course
blocks.description: Python Crash Course is another excellent book for those starting out in their Python journeys. It covers the basics very clearly and breaks down concepts in a very easy to understand manner. There are a good amount of fun exercises and you’re not thrown into them so early on that you feel lost.

blocks.title: Crash Course Cheat Sheets
blocks.description: Courtesy of No Starch Press, these downloadable pdf cheat sheets are the perfect companion to Python Crash Course. They"re great resources when you need refreshers, practice, and as quick coding resources

blocks.title: Learn Python From Scratch
blocks.description: Educative is a fantastic learning platform I discovered several months back and have started utilizing more frequently. Having been so accustomed to video courses, I was on the fence at first, but the platform is so well put together than it just drew me in.

blocks.title: Invent With Python
blocks.description: Thanks to Al Sweigart for all of his amazing contributions to the Python community. I’ve purchased his paperback books and still browse through this site for reference and fun projects to take on.

blocks.title: Real Python
blocks.description: Real Python has been my go to site lately for tutorials, courses, and especially the quizzes. There is a ton of content on this site with more added frequently

blocks.title: Complete Python Developer in 2020: Zero To Mastery

links.title: Complete Python Developer in 2020: Zero To Mastery

blocks.description: It’s no secret I have great admiration for Andrei Neagoie. He’s the top tier of online educators in my book. His Python course is just excellent from beginning to end. That being said, there is a ton of content to absorb. This is not a course to be rushed through if you are a Python beginner. Please, please take your time with this course.

blocks.title: Python and Flask Bootcamp
blocks.description: This course takes you through the fundamentals on HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, and Python before diving into Flask. Once there, you’ll learn how to create virtual environments for your Flask projects, how to create Flask forms, work with SQLite databases, REST APIs, and even Stripe payments. You’ll also learn how to create a blog in Flask and deploy to Heroku

blocks.title: Python and Django Full Stack Web Developer Bootcamp

links.title: Python and Django Full Stack Web Developer Bootcamp

blocks.description: Much like his Flask course, this is another great course by Jose Portilla. With over 26,000 students enrolled, Python and Django Full Stack is still one of the best selling courses on Udemy to date.

blocks.title: HackerRank
blocks.description: Finally, if you want to sharpen those Python skills and test your knowledge, sign up to HackerRank. There are vast amounts of practices, competitions, skill certification exams, and even interview preparation tutorials.

description: I started my excursion into Python in the fall of 2019. Since then, I"ve come across some resources that have really helped me a lot in learning the language. I wanted to take a bit of time to share my most valuable Python resources here for anyone searching for where to begin when diving into Python.
title: My Most Valuable Python Resources by Alex Corvin

author: 1064e558-2262-499c-9c99-e98281474886

blocks.title: Fullstack D3 and Data Visualization
blocks.description: This the holy grail of D3. It’s extremely accessible for anyone new to D3 and it’s structured in such an easy to follow manner that I’ve not felt overwhelmed by the content

blocks.title: Build Data Visualizations with D3.js & Firebase

links.title: Build Data Visualizations with D3.js & Firebase

blocks.description: What can I say of Shaun Pelling that I haven’t already said? His courses and tutorials are top notch and this one is no different.

blocks.title: D3js.org
blocks.description: When learning any programming language, you can do no wrong in going straight to the source. The documentation for D3 is so well written and provides a ton of examples

blocks.title: Dashing D3.js
blocks.description: Dashing D3 offers subscription based learning from beginner to intermediate level and is currently priced at $14.95 per month. The beginner course offers brief introductions to HTML, CSS, Javascript as well as getting to know SVGs. You’ll not only learn the basics of every type of chart, but also how to interact and animate each one.

description: It"s probably no secret that I love data. The moment I began researching D3.js, I just knew it was what I wanted to use to represent my data in visualization projects. I"ve been learning it for the better part of this year and I wanted to share the resources I"ve found to be just priceless in learning D3.
title: My Most Valuable D3 Resources by Alex Corvin

author: 1064e558-2262-499c-9c99-e98281474886

blocks.title: SQL Bolt
blocks.description: It"s basically a bunch of interactive lessons that teach you the basics of SQL.

blocks.title: SQL Zoo
blocks.description: SQL Zoo is a collection of tests that push your SQL knowledge to the limits. The challenges range from easy ones that you can solve in a couple of seconds to hard ones where your brains are pushed to it's limits.

blocks.title: Use the Index Luke
blocks.description: Luke!
. It"s a site that teaches you about writing efficient SQL code.

blocks.title: PostgreSQL Exercises
blocks.description: PostgreSQL is one of the world"s most popular database management systems. With that in mind, this platform has a bunch of exercises to test your SQL and PostgreSQL knowledge.

blocks.title: Khan Academy
blocks.description: I"ve used Khan Academy for all sorts of subjects and they never disappoint. This course offered by them covers the basics of SQL to more advanced topics such as JOINS, etc.

blocks.title: Udacity
blocks.description: If your more of a visual learner, I would recommend checking out Udacity. It covers beginner and intermediate topics. Along with the videos, it also included coding exercises.

blocks.title: SQL for Web Nerds
blocks.description: This is more of an advanced course, it teaches you the gritty details of SQL. It was developed by MIT Professor Philip Greenspun. The site isn"t flashy, but it offers expert-level content.

description: So, you want to go on the path of SQL? But don"t know where to start? Well, look no further. I"ve compiled a list of the best SQL resources I could find on the internet.
title: Top 7 Resources to Learn SQL

description: If you can"t explain it simply, you don"t understand it well enough -- Albert Einstein. Technical topics are some times hard to understand. If we can relate it with some real life example, if becomes super easy. Jean Michel has compiled for you some incredibly pedagogical answers from which a five year old can understand. Specifically he selected answers that were enlightening yet concise, and that explained with words only - no code.
title: 💥 Best of #explainLikeIamFive

blocks.description: Their online courses offer tons of subjects (as their front page says, “You can learn anything”), including many on computer programming. Topics taught: JS, HTML/CSS, SQL, much more.

blocks.description: When you don’t know where to start, open-source projects are a great way to begin. Searching for open-source projects is great because you’ll have to opportunity to interact with huge developers and learn how to write code in the right way.

blocks.title: Free Icons
blocks.description: Icons are known to express some information while providing good UI. These are used in many websites and as a frontend developer you probably need them in any website you"ll be making. Here are some free icons resources.

blocks.title: Free SVG illustration
blocks.description: Svg are essential part of modern websites and we no longer need to create them from scratch using html/css or other design tools like figma.

blocks.description: If you are wondering where to get free high quality images for your backgrounds, nature, people etc here are good sources

blocks.title: Free image resolution compressor
blocks.description: These tools will compress your images to reduce resolution and thus helps better your site"s performance without affecting image quality.

description: As a frontend developer, you have probably struggled to find images, svgs or icons to add to your application and sometimes the images you have are of high resolution that it takes a lot of time to paint when the website renders thus hindering website"s performance or couldn"t find high quality images. Here are five(5) resources which you might need while developing your application.
title: 5 resources I use as a front end developer that you probably need
